definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Within Congress, party discipline is less strictly observed in the American system than in parliamentary systems.
sentences.chinese: 與議會制相比，在國會內部不存在嚴格的黨紀黨規。

sentences.english: Her allies want to change the system of government from presidential to parliamentary.
sentences.chinese: 阿羅約的盟友要求改變政府制度從總統制改爲議會制。

sentences.english: Have dual and parliamentary-based two kinds.
sentences.chinese: 有二元制和議會制兩種。

sentences.english: Parliamentarianism may also be for governance in local governments.
sentences.chinese: 議會制也可用於治理地方政府。
